result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Seaberry, Rashaun A

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Richard Henry Hart Jr. in court for Rashaun A Seaberry. Defendant Rashaun A Seaberry in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Status Conference. Defendant has a pending case that is not joinable. Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 45 days. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:15 am.
ORDER FROM THE COURT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY SHERIFF ALLOWING THE DEFENDANT, RASHAUN A. SEABERRY, ACCESS TO DISCOVERY MATERIAL, filed.

Attorney Richard Henry Hart in court, defendant Rashaun A Seaberry not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 6. Case set for Status Conference. Defedant has lower pending case 21CF1555 set for trial to which state needs an adjournment. Case will remain on Branch 38 calendar. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Rashaun A Seaberry in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Rashaun A Seaberry in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case to tag with other felony case set for trial as status. Case adjourned in Branch 15.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rashaun A Seaberry in court, appear by video with attorney Richard Henry Hart, appear in person.  Defendant Rashaun A Seaberry in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Saavedra &  Detective C. Donahue.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $125,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Camiona F, Jamara T R,Tajianna A T, and Co-actors: Daylin Bridges and Omarion McNealy.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rashaun A Seaberry in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Rashaun A Seaberry in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rashaun A Seaberry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to the pending matters of the co-actors, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
